## Configure Git

- to do so, install install.packages("git2r")
- in case of error missing libgit2 (a C library, to interface with Git repositories)
  - to execute commands inside the docker container as root user, enter the following in terminal after SSH into CCRI: docker exec -it <container-id-or-name> bash 
  - then install libgit2: 
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install libgit2-dev

```{setting up workflowR}
library(workflowr)

# Configure Git (only need to do once per computer)
wflow_git_config(user.name = "LazDaria", user.email = "daria_lazic@yahoo.com")

# Start a new workflowr project
wflow_start("MapMetSC")

# Build the site
wflow_build()

# Customize your site!
#   1. Edit the R Markdown files in analysis/
#   2. Edit the theme and layout in analysis/_site.yml
#   3. Add new or copy existing R Markdown files to analysis/

# Preview your changes
wflow_build()

# Publish the site, i.e. version the source code and HTML results
wflow_publish("analysis/*", "Start my new project")
```
